com.att.research.xacml.api

Interface Attribute

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JaxpAttribute, StdAttribute, StdMutableAttribute

    public interface Attribute
    Defines the API for objects that represent XACML 3.0 Attribute elements.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      The implementation of the Attribute interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Attributes (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getAttributeId().equals(a2.getAttributeId()) AND a1.getCategory().equals(a2.getCategory()) AND a1.getIssuer().equals(a2.getIssuer()) or both issuers are null AND a1.getIncludeInResults() == a2.getIncludeInResults AND a1.getValues() is pair-wise equal to a2.getValues()
      <T> java.util.Iterator<AttributeValue<T>> findValues(DataType<T> dataType)
      Finds all of the AttributeValue objects with the given DataType in the AttributeValues for this Attribute.
      Identifier getAttributeId()
      Gets the Identifier for this Attribute object.
      Identifier getCategory()
      Gets the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 Category of this Attribute.
      boolean getIncludeInResults()
      Gets the boolean value indicating whether this Attribute should be included in the com.att.research.xacml.Response to a XACML 3.0 Request.
      java.lang.String getIssuer()
      Gets the String issuer of this Attribute.
      java.util.Collection<AttributeValue<?>> getValues()
      Gets the Collection of AttributeValue objects for this Attribute.

    • Method Detail

      • getAttributeId

        Identifier getAttributeId()
        Gets the Identifier for this Attribute object. The Identifier uniquely identifies a XACML 3.0 Attribute element in a Request, Policy, or Response document.
        Returns:
        the Identifier for this Attribute

      • getCategory

        Identifier getCategory()
        Gets the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 Category of this Attribute.
        Returns:
        the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 Category of this Attribute.

      • getValues

        java.util.Collection<AttributeValue<?>> getValues()
        Gets the Collection of AttributeValue objects for this Attribute. If there are no AttributeValues in this Attribute, an empty Collection must be returned. The returned Collection should not be modified. Implementations are free to return an immutable view to enforce this.
        Returns:
        a Collection of the AttributeValues for this Attribute

      • findValues

        <T> java.util.Iterator<AttributeValue<T>> findValues(DataType<T> dataType)
        Finds all of the AttributeValue objects with the given DataType in the AttributeValues for this Attribute. If there are no matching AttributeValues, an empty Iterator must be returned.
        Parameters:
        dataType - the DataType to filter on
        Returns:
        an Iterator over all of the AttributeValues of the given DataType.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the supplied DataType is null

      • getIssuer

        java.lang.String getIssuer()
        Gets the String issuer of this Attribute. If the Attribute does not have an issuer, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the String issuer of this Attribute.

      • getIncludeInResults

        boolean getIncludeInResults()
        Gets the boolean value indicating whether this Attribute should be included in the com.att.research.xacml.Response to a XACML 3.0 Request.
        Returns:
        true if this Attribute should be included in the Response else false.

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        The implementation of the Attribute interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Attributes (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getAttributeId().equals(a2.getAttributeId()) AND a1.getCategory().equals(a2.getCategory()) AND a1.getIssuer().equals(a2.getIssuer()) or both issuers are null AND a1.getIncludeInResults() == a2.getIncludeInResults AND a1.getValues() is pair-wise equal to a2.getValues()
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
